events.name: FCL Lunch Talk: Digital Underground - A journey towards a reliable 3D map of Singapore’s underground utility networks
events.description:
Digital Underground: A journey towards a reliable 3D map of Singapore’s underground utility networks. 
The Digital Underground project is an initiative embarked on by the Singapore-ETH Centre together with Singapore Land Authority and the City of Zürich that aims to develop a roadmap for a reliable 3D map of subsurface utility networks in Singapore. In this presentation, we will introduce this unique project and its collaboration between research and government professionals and reflect on the opportunities and challenges that exist towards realising an ecosystem for reliable utility mapping. Also, we will provide an overview of the state of technology for 3D utility mapping and highlight opportunities for future research.

Rob van Son is Project Coordinator of the Digital Underground project. He has over 10 years of experience in applied scientific research, public sector consulting and product development. He enjoys developing new solutions for real-world problems by connecting cutting-edge research, technology providers, and end users. Previously, he held positions at the Netherlands organisation for applied scientific research TNO and SEC's Future Resilient Systems program. 
Jaw Siow Wei is a postdoc researcher of the Digital Underground project. Her expertise encompasses remote sensing and geoinformation for applied and environmental sciences related research and development and innovation, specialising in the use of non-destructive technologies for underground mapping. Before joining SEC, she was a senior lecturer in the Department of Geoinformation, Faculty of Geoinformation & Real Estate and research fellow of Geoscience and Digital Earth Centre (INSTeG) at Universiti Teknologi Malaysia (UTM).
events.location: Value Lab Asia, Singapore-ETH Centre, #06-01, CREATE Tower, 1 Create Way, Singapore 138602

events.name: Your future in Artificial Intelligence
events.description: Pressure for responsible AI won’t be on tech companies alone. Invasion of privacy, algorithmic bias, environmental damage, threats to brands and the bottom line – fears around AI are numerous. Join us at this session where we invite PwC Singapore’s subject matter experts to share mega-trends on working towards Responsible AI and career opportunities in this space. 4.45pm Registration5.00pm Opening AddressLaurence Liew, Director, AI Industry Innovation, AI Singapore5.10pm Megatrends in Technology and the increasing risksJenny Tan, Partner, Digital Trust, PwC Singapore5.40pm Panel DiscussionModerated by: Mark Jansen, Data & Analytics Leader, PwC S'porePanelists:Laurence Liew, Director, AI Industry Innovation, AI SingaporeAng Wee Tiong, Co-founder, JobTech6.15pm Impact of AI in a career in Digital TrustJenny Tan, Partner, Digital Trust, PwC Singapore6.30pm Networking / Light Refreshments

events.name: Deep Learning for IoT- Voice Recognition & Autonomous Vehicles
events.description: Deep learning is a promising approach for extracting accurate information from raw sensor data from IoT devices deployed in complex environments. Because of its multilayer structure, deep learning is also appropriate for the edge computing environment. After the successful weekend bootcamp attended by 100+ participants in Feb, in this follow-up session, Sandeep will provide an introduction to Deep Learning, core technologies, methodologies and approach on how Deep Learning can enable IoT applications. DATE: Thurs, May 10, 2018 TIME: 6.00 pm – 9:00 pm: 1. Registration & Networking 2. Introduction to Basic Terms and how they fit together: 2.1. AI, Big Data, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, 2.2. IOT, Neural Networks Brief overview of use case of Deep Learning How to Approach a Deep Learning Problem: 4.1. How to approach? 4.2. Which Tools? 4.3. Which Algorithms? Questions & Answers Networking Continued PLACE: NUS Enterprise, #02-01, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, Singapore  For last 14+ years, Sandeep (https://www.linkedin.com/in/girisandeep/) has been building products and churning large amounts of data for various product firms. He has an all-around experience of software development and big data analysis. Apart from digging data and technologies, Sandeep enjoys conducting interviews and explaining difficult concepts in simple ways. Prior to founding CloudxLab and KnowBigData he worked at Amazon.com, InMobi.com, and D.E.Shaw. He graduated from Indian Institute of Technology, Roorkee in Chemical Engineering. *****************************************************************************************  Join IoTSG (https://www.meetup.com/iot_sg/) Join IoTSG Validated network, fill in your details. (https://goo.gl/forms/FvTquNP7RiyS6f1m1) ______________________________________________________________________________________ About AllThingsConnected (http://athingsc.com/) AllThingsConnected is a project organization based in Singapore. ATC focuses on Digital Strategy, Solutions Architecture and Program Management of ConnectedSoluions (IoT/DigitalTransformation) projects in Industrial/Manufacturing, Built Environment, Agriculture & Energy. About IoTSG (http://iotsg.org/) IoTSG is the largest IoT focused initiative in SEA, empowering and enabling professionals, and hence the organizations by helping them understand true value and approach of IoT as Business & Solutions. IoTSG has hosted and supported 65+ IoT focused events/conference (regional and international). We have over 3.2K professionals in our network in the region. Our aim is to enable a collaborative IoT ecosystem among organizations, government agencies, and professionals to accelerate initiatives such as Smart Cities, Agriculture, Building, Healthcare and so on. About CloudxLab (https://cloudxlab.com/) CloudxLab is a leader in the domain of Big Data, Artificial Intelligence, Deep Learning, Machine Learning and related technologies. The company provides consulting, training, solutions and products related to above-mentioned technologies.
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951

events.name: SUSS Meetup: Asset Sharing Economy and Decentralized Transport in Smart City
events.description: Hey Likers, Given the recent anti-competition discussion on the Uber-Grab merger, the idea of using decentralised technology and ownership with centralised governance may be an interesting alternative.Please register at their eventbrite link:https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/suss-meetup-asset-sharing-economy-decentralised-transport-in-smart-city-tickets-45638398679 Professor Boyd Cohen will give a fresh perspective to the arguments and alternatives to transport based on centralised technology. At this Meetup, young influencers and founders in Singapore will further share their aspirations in our quest of becoming the world’s smart city. Professor David LEE Kuo Chuen will also present the idea of distributed innovation for the leapfrogging of developing countries and the hidden value of decentralised technology such as blockchain to protect the smart city from AI dominance. Programme Details6:00pm: Registration, dinner, and networking 7:00pm: "The view of IoMob and the Smart City" by Prof. Boyd COHEN, EADA Business School / IoMob 7:40pm: Young Influencers: Blockchain Gap Year for Under 22s 8:15pm: "Distributed Innovation and Blockchain" by Prof. David LEE Kuo Chuen, SUSS 8:45pm: Networking session
events.location: SUSS, 461 Clementi Road, Block B Level 2 LT B.2.03, Singapore

events.name: Ship Propulsion Optimisation & Energy Efficiency: Experiences with Unconventional High Efficiency Tip Plate Propellers
events.description:
Technical Talk
Organised by
The Society of Naval Architects and Marine Engineers Singapore (SNAMES)
The Joint Branch of the RINA and the IMarEST (Singapore)
Centre for Offshore Research & Engineering (CORE), NUS

Ship Propulsion Optimisation & Energy Efficiency: Experiences with Unconventional High Efficiency Tip Plate Propellers
By 
Dr Giulio Gennaro,
1888 Gennaro Consulting Pte Ltd
 
Date   :         10th May 2017, Thursday
Time  :         6:30 pm to 7:00 pm Registration & Refreshment
                   Talk begins at 7:00 p.m. and ends at 8.00 p.m.
Venue:         LT 78, Ngee Ann Polytechnic, 535 Clementi Road, Singapore, 599489
  
Abstract
The current market trend, the concern for pollution and the introduction of both the Energy Efficiency Design Index and the Energy Efficiency Operational Indicator (EEDI and EEOI) are all factors that require propulsion systems to be the more and more efficient.
Efficiency, as a whole, is the results of three non-intersecting matters: the generation of power: i.e. how efficient the prime mover is in converting the potential energy of the fuel into mechanical power the usage of power: i.e. how efficient the vessel in using the minimum possible mechanical power to advance through the water; the operating envelope: i.e. how efficient the operators are in maximizing operations in favourable conditions and in minimizing operations in adverse conditions (such as ballast trips, sailing in adverse environmental conditions...).
Notwithstanding the above a large number of new buildings is still substandard in respect to propulsive efficiency and many of the so called “Green” or “Eco” designs can be further optimised.
The scenario for ships in service is, in general, even worse and it is possible to increase substantially the propulsive efficiency of existing vessels, both by means of propulsion improving devices (PID) and, foremost, by means of Unconventional Tip Shape Propellers.
Historically much has been achieved in the reduction of the advance resistance of the hull, naked and appended. In addition, many Propulsion Improving Devices (PID) have been invented, later abandoned and then reinvented and reintroduced in conjunction with energy crisis. Nowadays the PID portfolio spans over pre-swirlers, swirl recoverers, ducts, hull fins, rudder fins, bulbed or twisted rudders, hub caps... either alone or combined one with the other.
On the contrary propellers have gone through very little innovation: little is worth mentioning apart from the introduction of high skew and a continuous improvement of the annular profiles.
At the same time two types of unconventional propellers have been developed: surface propellers, which bear little interest for commercial shipping, and Unconventional Tip Shape Propellers.
Since then the Unconventional Tip Shape Propeller concept has evolved continuously and nowadays two different types of Unconventional Tip Shape Propellers are available for ship propulsion: MAN Kappel propellers and SISTEMAR CLT ® propellers.
From late 80's Unconventional Tip Shape Propellers, in particular of CLT type, have been installed in relatively high number at full scale (about 400 vessels, from hydrofoils to bulk carriers, from Ro-Pax to VLCC) and have always shown their superior performance when compared to conventional propellers.
Despite this fact Unconventional Tip Shape Propellers are still unbeknown to most Ship Owners, Technical Managers, Ship Designers and Shipyards.
In this context it should be noted that propellers considered “new” by employing technologies such as, Tip Rake, Wide Tip Chord and New / Advanced Profiles are conventional propellers in all respects. They can offer limited advantages over “standard” conventional propeller designs but they cannot rival the propulsive efficiency of Unconventional Tip Shape Propellers.
During the technical talk a comprehensive technology review of Unconventional Tip Shape Propellers, and in particular of CLT propellers, will presented with the aim of promoting their knowledge and use, both for new building and as retrofit.

About the Speaker
Giulio Gennaro received is education in Mechanical Engineering at the University of Genoa. After graduating he moved to Augsburg, Germany, where he worked for MAN & Diesel, first as test bed engineer then as Turbocharging R&D engineer. He then joined RINA HQ, Genoa, where he was responsible for plan approval, type approval and calculations for machinery, in particular Diesel engines, gearboxes, shatlines and propellers. In 2003 he started working as freelance independent consultant, focusing on failure investigation, root cause analysis, litigation support and forensic engineering, in particular in relations to plants and machinery, both for naval, onshore and offshore applications. In parallel he started cooperating with Sistemar, Madrid, a company responsible for the development and the design of Contracted and Loaded Tip Propellers (CLT Propellers). Thanks to his collaboration with Sistemar he has developed a deep understanding and insight of naval propulsion, propeller design and propulsion monitoring. He has taken part in many international activities and R&D campaigns on naval propulsion together with leading players and institutions such as Carnival Corporation, A.P. Moeller Maersk, US Navy, VTT, HSVA, CEHIPAR, ABB... He is the author and co-author of many papers on non-conventional propeller and ship propulsion.
He was a guest lecturer at the University of Genoa on subjects such as Failure Investigation, ship valuation, H&M and P&I surveys, Risk Assessment.
He moved to Singapore in January 2015 as Technical Director of RockTree, a shipping / logistic company managing Offshore Floating Transhippers, there he focused on improving maintenance practices and overall reliability and availability of the plants and on digitalization.
In 2017 he incorporated his consultancy company in Singapore providing high level technical consultancies in relation to failure investigation, litigation support, forensic engineering and propulsion optimisation / energy saving.
He is Member of AIPAM, the Italian Association of Expert in Maritime Casualties. He is Member of SNAMES, the Society of Naval Architects an Marine Engineers, Singapore. He is Member of the Technical Committee on LNG Bunkering, Singapore. Location Map

All members are welcome and admission is free 
 but early registration is needed.
No filming or walk-in guest is allowed for this event.
events.location: Lecture Theater 78, Ngee Ann Polytechnic, 535 Clementi Road, Singapore 599489
events.group_name: SNAMES, Joint Branch of RINA & IMarEST and CORE(NUS)

events.name: Game Design with Scratch Programming
events.description: Help Grizz from We Bare Bears fulfil his late night hunger pangs! Learn the basics of coding for game design with the use of Scratch, a free online tool where you can program your own interactive stories, games, and animations. During this special 3-part course, you’ll be making use of block programming to create a food hunting adventure based on the character Grizz (from We Bare Bears). Part 1 (10th May) - Game Design Part 2 (17th May) - Game Design + Animation Part 3 (24th May) - Animation Bring your laptop and yourself and you’ll be all set! Tickets can be purchased at http://game-design-scratch.peatix.com. Limited to 15 pax.
events.location: The Hive Lavender, 1 Kallang Junction, Level 6 Vanguard Campus, Singapore

events.name: Introducing Data Science through its methods
events.description: Data Science is a broad and diverse field comprised of a few families of methodologies: Business Intelligence, Unsupervised Learning, Supervised Learning, Reinforcement Learning, Optimization, as well as Systems Modelling & Simulation. These families are distinguished by their purposes, and the kinds of data that is required to use them. This talk will introduce data science through an overview of its methods and where they may be applied. This talk is crafted to be accessible to the non-technical, but to also be of interest to the technologist. Hopefully, even a practicing data scientist may find something of interest. We will begin by discussing a past data science project to give those interested in data science an idea of what a project might entail. Then, we will talk about the various families of methods and how they might be used. We will conclude by touching on how one can get started with data science. This event is sponsored by UpCode Academy. About the speaker:This talk will be conducted by our Head of Data Science, Jeremy. Jeremy holds a PhD in Decision Sciences at the National University of Singapore and a Master's Degree at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology in Computation for Design and Optimization, where he did a thesis on randomised methods for convex optimization. Jeremy later earned a PhD in Decision Sciences at the National University of Singapore in 2017, with a thesis on "Social Networks and the Choices People Make" (discrete choice on social networks). During his PhD days, he also worked on recommendation systems and a start-up building solutions for compliance in pharmaceutical manufacturing.
events.location: Tri5 Ventures, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent #03-26, S139951, Singapore

events.name: External OIDC, Identity Server, and UI Framework Blazor
events.description: Details In this meetup, we are proud to have Riza Marhaban and Dawa Law to join us to talk about two exciting topics which are related to the trending technologies, Identity Server, Xamarin, and Blazor. AGENDA: SESSION 1: External OIDC Authentication in Xamarin Forms using Identity Server - RizaIn this session, Riza will show us how IdentityServer, which is a centralized login logic and workflow for all of your applications from web to mobile to API, can be used to authenticate users in Xamarin Forms. SESSION 2: Getting Started on Blazor - DawaA quick dive into Blazor, an experimental .NET web framework using C#/Razor and HTML that runs in the browser via WebAssembly (http://webassembly.org/). Finally, do join this meetup and and also invite your friends to join this meetup. Many thanks for your support and help. Your friendly co-organizer,Chun Lin ============================ FOOD On a happier note, Microsoft would be sponsoring food for this meetup, so we need RSVP. ============================ IMPORTANT TO KNOW: YOUR PHOTO ID! Kindly remember to bring your photo ID (NRIC, EP or Work Permit, Student Pass, Passport) to get through NTUC Centre Building security at Level 1.
events.location: 22CF12, Level 22, Microsoft Singapore, Singapore 018989, One Marina Boulevard
